org.openimaj.image.pixel.sampling

Class QuadtreeSampler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.pixel.sampling.QuadtreeSampler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Rectangle>

    public class QuadtreeSampler
extends Object
implements Iterable<Rectangle>
    A QuadtreeSampler provides an easy way of extracting sample patches from an image or other domain in both spatial and scale directions. The sampling regions returned by the sampler form a quadtree. At the first level there is a single sample region covering the entire region; at the second level, there are 4 non-overlapping sample regions, and so on.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        public QuadtreeSampler(Rectangle r,

        Construct the sampler with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        r - the size of the initial sample region on the first level
        nLevels - the number of levels to sample over

      • levelIterator

        public Iterator<RectangleSampler> levelIterator()
        Create an iterator over each of the levels in the pyramid. Each level is represented by a RectangleSampler that describes the individual rectangles on a level.
        Returns:
        an iterator over the levels.
